eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Corticosteroid stability
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: If receiving budesonide or beclomethasone dipropionate, the dose must have been stable for at least 2 weeks.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Corticosteroid/5-ASA discontinuation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: If oral 5-ASA compounds or oral corticosteroids have been recently discontinued, they must have been stopped for at least 2 weeks.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Rectal corticosteroid discontinuation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Rectal corticosteroids (ie, corticosteroids administered to the rectum or sigmoid colon via foam or enema or suppository) for at least 2 weeks.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: TNF-antagonist discontinuation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: TNF-antagonist therapy (eg, infliximab, etanercept, certolizumab, adalimumab, golimumab [or approved biosimilars for these therapies]) for at least 8 weeks.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Adenomatous polyps screening
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: A subject ≥45 years of age must either have had a full colonoscopy to assess for the presence of adenomatous polyps within 5 years before the first administration of study agent or a full colonoscopy to assess for the presence of adenomatous polyps at the screening visit. The adenomatous polyps must be removed before the first administration of study agent.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Dysplasia/Malignancy screening
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: A subject who has had extensive colitis for ≥8 years, or disease limited to the left side of the colon for ≥10 years, must either have had a full colonoscopy to assess for the presence of dysplasia within 1 year before the first administration of study agent or a full colonoscopy to assess for the presence of malignancy at the screening visit.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Tuberculosis screening
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: All subjects will undergo QuantiFERON-TB Gold testing. In countries where the QuantiFERON-TB Gold test is not registered/approved, TB skin testing will also be required. A tuberculin skin test is recommended but not required for study centers in Ukraine if tuberculin is not available.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Laboratory parameters
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Has screening laboratory test results within the following parameters: a. Hemoglobin ≥8.0 g/dL (SI: ≥80.0 g/L); b. White blood cell count (WBC) ≥3 × 103 cells/μL (SI: ≥3.0 × 109 cells/L); c. Neutrophils ≥1.5 × 103 cells /μL (SI: ≥1.5 × 109 cells/L); d. Platelets ≥100 × 103 cells /μL (SI: ≥100 × 109 cells/L); e. Serum creatinine ≤1.5 mg/dL (SI: ≤133 μmol/L); f. Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) concentrations must be within 2 times the upper limit of the normal range (ULN).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Apheresis exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Apheresis (eg, Adacolumn or Cellsorba apheresis) within 2 weeks before the first administration of study agent.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatitis C exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Are seropositive for antibodies to hepatitis C virus (HCV) without a history of successful treatment, defined as being negative for HCV RNA at least 24 weeks after completing antiviral treatment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Drug/Alcohol abuse exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Has a history of drug or alcohol abuse according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 5th edition (DSM-V), within 1 year before screening.
